skill.name: youtrack
skill.description: Interacts with YouTrack issue tracker for IdeaVim. Use when working with tickets (VIM-XXXX), adding comments, managing tags, setting status, or release management. This project does NOT use GitHub Issues - use YouTrack instead.
skill.summary: Interacts with YouTrack issue tracker for IdeaVim. Use when working with tickets (VIM-XXXX), adding ...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: The skill file is documentation only and contains no executable code. No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns are present.

content.value_statement: Tracking VIM issues is slow when you are unsure of the correct YouTrack workflow. This skill gives clear commands for comments, tags, status, and releases.
actual_capabilities: Add public or private comments to VIM tickets using CLI commands
Add or remove tags on VIM tickets with tag IDs
Set ticket status values like Ready To Release
Fetch ticket details with optional JSON output
Create or delete YouTrack release versions
limitations: Requires a valid YOUTRACK_TOKEN environment variable
Applies only to YouTrack, not GitHub Issues
Assumes VIM ticket keys for IdeaVim
Relies on external CLI scripts not included in this folder

use_cases.title: Update ticket status
use_cases.description: Move VIM tickets to Ready To Release after verification

use_cases.title: Manage release versions
use_cases.description: Create or delete YouTrack versions for IdeaVim releases

use_cases.title: Add review comments
use_cases.description: Post public or private comments requesting review

prompt_templates.title: Add comment
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner: comment on a VIM ticket
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a public comment to VIM-1234 saying the issue is reproduced in 2.28.0.

prompt_templates.title: Tag ticket
prompt_templates.prompt: Add the claude-analyzed tag to VIM-1234 and confirm the tag ID used.

prompt_templates.title: Set status
prompt_templates.prompt: Set VIM-1234 status to Ready To Release.

prompt_templates.title: Release version
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a YouTrack release version 2.29.0 and set VIM-1234 fix version to 2.29.0.

output_examples.input: Add a private comment to VIM-1234 asking for clarification from Aleksei.Plate.

best_practices: Confirm the correct VIM ticket key before acting
Use private comments for internal requests
Reuse the documented tag IDs to avoid mistakes
anti_patterns: Using GitHub Issues commands for IdeaVim tickets
Posting sensitive details in public comments
Setting status without verifying ticket readiness

faq.question: Is this compatible with all YouTrack projects?
faq.answer: It is documented for the IdeaVim YouTrack project and VIM ticket keys.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: You need a valid YOUTRACK_TOKEN and the external CLI scripts available.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my local scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflow uses CLI commands you can call from scripts.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, the skill file is documentation only and does not execute code.

faq.question: What if a command fails?
faq.answer: Check the token, ticket key, and YouTrack permissions, then retry.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Issues?
faq.answer: It targets YouTrack only and does not support GitHub Issues.
